document_summary.short_summary: The report card of Easton David Olmstead, a Grade 9 student at Maplewood S.S., evaluates his performance across multiple courses with grades ranging from 78% to 88% and highlights learning skills. Teachers have provided comments for improvement and requested interviews with parents. The document includes detailed evaluations and attendance records, issued by the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board.
document_summary.detailed_summary:
This document is a comprehensive report card for Easton David Olmstead, a Grade 9 student at Maplewood Secondary School, part of the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board. The report card covers the first term of the second semester of the 2024-2025 academic year. It provides detailed assessments of Easton's performance in subjects including Repertoire, Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset, Exploring Canadian Geography, Mathematics, and Science.

The report card includes percentage grades for each subject, which range from 78% to 88%, and provides additional context through course medians and specific teacher comments. These comments highlight Easton's strengths and outline specific areas where he can improve. Furthermore, teachers have expressed a desire to discuss Easton's progress further, requesting interviews with his parents.

In addition to academic performance, the report card evaluates Easton's learning skills, such as responsibility, organization, independent work, collaboration, initiative, and self-regulation. These skills are crucial for his overall development and are rated alongside his academic performance, with Easton generally receiving 'Excellent' or 'Good' ratings.

The document also includes Easton's attendance record, showing minimal absences and tardiness, underscoring his commitment to his education. The report card is an essential communication tool between the school and Easton's family, providing insights into his educational journey and facilitating discussions for his further improvement.
key_insights: Easton's academic performance is commendable, with grades ranging from 78% to 88%.
Teachers have identified specific areas for improvement and are seeking parental involvement through interviews.
Learning skills such as responsibility and organization are critically evaluated and play a significant role in Easton's educational development.
The report card reflects minimal issues with attendance, highlighting Easton's dedication.
The document serves as an important communication tool between the school and Easton's family, aiming to support his educational progress.

2.one_sentence_summary: The report card details Easton Olmstead's academic performance and learning skills in various subjects for semester 2, term 1 of the 2024-2025 school year.
2.full_summary:
- Student: Easton Olmstead, Grade 9, attends Maplewood S.S., part of the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board.
- Reporting period: Semester 2 Term 1 of the 2024-2025 school year, dated April 28, 2025.
- Includes courses: Repertoire, Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset, Exploring Canadian Geography, Mathematics, and Science.
- Performance: Marks range from 78% to 88% with comments on strengths and areas for improvement.
- Learning skills assessed: Responsibility, Organization, Independent Work, Collaboration, Initiative, and Self-Regulation.
- Teacher requests interviews for all listed courses.
- Attendance: Minimal classes missed and times late.
- Principal: Krista Hudson, School Council Chair: Kirsty Edwards.
2.key_information: Easton Olmstead, a Grade 9 student, displayed strong performance with marks between 78% and 88%. Teacher interviews are requested for all courses listed. Minimal attendance issues were noted.
noteworthy_sentences: Easton demonstrates good large ensemble skills and collaborates effectively with his peers.
Easton is encouraged to be more confident in his abilities, and to be patient with himself when running into difficulty completing work.
Shows considerable understanding of science concepts.
2.visual_elements: The page includes structured tables listing courses, marks, learning skills, and comments. There are no additional images, charts, or infographics.

full_summary: The report card is for Easton David Olmstead, a Grade 9 student at Maplewood S.S.
It includes grades for four courses: Repertoire, Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset, Exploring Canadian Geography, and Mathematics.
Teachers have provided specific comments on Easton's performance and areas for improvement, with several requesting interviews.
Attendance records show minimal classes missed and tardiness.
The report card is issued by the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board and is signed by Principal Krista Hudson.

Easton is a very creative thinker who takes his time to complete tasks and evaluations properly.
Understands mathematical concepts. Participates well in class.

4.one_sentence_summary: The report card details Easton David Olmstead's performance and learning skills in various Grade 9 courses during the 2024-2025 semester.
full_summary: The report card is for Easton David Olmstead, a Grade 9 student at Maplewood S.S., under the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board.
It includes detailed grades and evaluations for courses such as Repertoire, Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset, Exploring Canadian Geography, Mathematics, and Science.
Easton's performance is generally strong, with grades ranging from 78 to 88 in different subjects.
Each course evaluation includes comments on strengths, areas for improvement, and a request for parent-teacher interviews.
Learning skills such as responsibility, organization, independent work, collaboration, initiative, and self-regulation are graded, with Easton often receiving 'Excellent' or 'Good'.
The document outlines the achievement levels for provincial curriculum expectations and defines various acronyms related to educational modifications.
key_information: Easton is in Grade 9 at Maplewood S.S.
His grades range from 78 to 88 across different subjects.
Learning skills are assessed as mostly 'Excellent' or 'Good'.
The report card follows the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board standards.
noteworthy_sentences: Easton demonstrates good large ensemble skills and collaborates effectively with his peers.
Easton is encouraged to be more confident in his abilities, and to be patient with himself when running into difficulty completing work.
Shows considerable understanding of science concepts. Listens attentively in class and follows directions independently.

4.raw_text:
Student: Olmstead, Easton David
OEN: 735-011-272
Grade: 09
Homeroom: 224
Percentage
Mark
Achievement of the Provincial Curriculum Expectations
80–100
The student has demonstrated the required knowledge and skills with a high degree of effectiveness.
Achievement surpasses the provincial standard.  (Level 4)
70–79
The student has demonstrated the required knowledge and skills with considerable effectiveness.
Achievement meets the provincial standard.  (Level 3)
60–69
The student has demonstrated the required knowledge and skills with some effectiveness.
Achievement approaches the provincial standard.  (Level 2)
50–59
The student has demonstrated the required knowledge and skills with limited effectiveness.
Achievement falls much below the provincial standard.  (Level 1)
Below 50
The student has not demonstrated the required knowledge and skills. Extensive remediation is required.
I
Insufficient evidence to assign a percentage mark (for Grade 9 and 10 courses only)
W
The student has withdrawn from the course.
ESL/ELD – Achievement is based on expectations modified from the curriculum expectations for the course to support English
language learning needs.
IEP – Individual Education Plan
FRENCH – The student receives instruction in French for the course.
SHSM – Specialist High Skills Major (for Grade 11 and 12 courses only)
Course Median  – The median is the percentage mark at which 50 per cent of the students in the course have a higher
percentage mark and 50 per cent of the students have a lower percentage mark.

3.one_sentence_summary: The Provincial Report Card for Easton David Olmstead outlines his academic performance, learning skills, and teacher comments for the 2024-2025 semester.
full_summary: Easton David Olmstead is a Grade 9 student at Maplewood S.S., part of the Ottawa-Carleton District School Board.
The report card covers his performance in various courses including Repertoire, Building the Entrepreneurial Mindset, Exploring Canadian Geography, Mathematics, and Science.
Each course includes percentage marks, course median, learning skills ratings, and comments on strengths and next steps for improvement.
Teachers have requested interviews for further discussion on Easton's progress.
The report card also details Easton's attendance record and emphasizes the importance of learning skills and work habits.

3.raw_text:
Learning Skills and Work Habits
E – Excellent      G – Good      S – Satisfactory      N – Needs Improvement
Responsibility
 • Fulfils responsibilities and commitments within the learning
   environment.
 • Completes and submits class work, homework, and assignments
   according to agreed-upon timelines.
 • Takes responsibility for and manages own behaviour.
Independent Work
 • Independently monitors, assesses, and revises plans to complete
   tasks and meet goals.
 • Uses class time appropriately to complete tasks.
 • Follows instructions with minimal supervision.
Initiative
 • Looks for and acts on new ideas and opportunities for learning.
 • Demonstrates the capacity for innovation and a willingness to
   take risks.
 • Demonstrates curiosity and interest in learning.
 • Approaches new tasks with a positive attitude.
 • Recognizes and advocates appropriately for the rights of self and
   others.
Organization
 • Devises and follows a plan and process for completing work and
   tasks.
 • Establishes priorities and manages time to complete tasks and
   achieve goals.
 • Identifies, gathers, evaluates, and uses information, technology,
   and resources to complete tasks.
Collaboration
 • Accepts various roles and an equitable share of work in a group.
 • Responds positively to the ideas, opinions, values, and traditions of
   others.
 • Builds healthy peer-to-peer relationships through personal and
   media-assisted interactions.
 • Works with others to resolve conflicts and build consensus to
   achieve group goals.
 • Shares information, resources, and expertise, and promotes critical
   thinking to solve problems and make decisions.
Self-Regulation
 • Sets own individual goals and monitors progress towards achieving
   them.
 • Seeks clarification or assistance when needed.
 • Assesses and reflects critically on own strengths, needs, and
   interests.
 • Identifies learning opportunities, choices, and strategies to meet
   personal needs and achieve goals.
 • Perseveres and makes an effort when responding to challenges.
(Please complete, sign, and detach the form below, and return it to your child's teacher.)
